label: thm-expected-raw-distance-bound
name: Bound on the Expected Raw Distance Vector Change
natural_language_statement: Let S1 and S2 be two swarm states, with at least two alive walkers in S1 (k1 ≥ 2). The squared Euclidean distance between the expected raw distance vectors of the two swarms is deterministically bounded by a function of the displacement components (positional displacement Δ_pos² and status change count n_c), with coefficients that depend on the algorithmic space diameter D_Y and the initial number of alive walkers k1. Specifically: ||E[d(S1)] - E[d(S2)]||² ≤ C_pos,d·Δ_pos² + C_status,d⁽¹⁾·n_c + C_status,d⁽²⁾(k1)·n_c² where the coefficients are C_pos,d = 12, C_status,d⁽¹⁾ = D_Y², and C_status,d⁽²⁾(k1) = 8k1 D_Y²/(k1-1)².

raw_fallback.label: thm-expected-raw-distance-bound
raw_fallback.title: Bound on the Expected Raw Distance Vector Change
raw_fallback.statement: Let $\mathcal{S}_1$ and $\mathcal{S}_2$ be two swarm states, with $|\mathcal{A}(\mathcal{S}_1)| = k_1 \ge 2$. Let $\mathbb{E}[\mathbf{d}(\mathcal{S})]$ be the $N$-dimensional vector of expected raw distances. The squared Euclidean distance between the expected raw distance vectors of the two swarms is deterministically bounded by a function of the displacement components.
raw_fallback.proof_sketch: 1. Decompose the total error into stable and unstable walker contributions using thm-total-expected-distance-error-decomposition. 2. Bound the unstable walker error using lem-total-squared-error-unstable. 3. Bound the stable walker error using lem-total-squared-error-stable. 4. Combine the two bounds and formalize by naming the coefficients.
